body:
Radiance uses slightly different color primaries and a different  
(neutral) white point than the CCIR709 set that is the basis for sRGB  
(and other RGB) standards.  This is historical, but not without  
reason, which is why you should stick with the xyz_rgb.cal file for  
back-and-forth conversions.


Best,
-Greg
___
<sup>Automatically generated content from [radiance mailing-list](https://radiance-online.org/pipermail/radiance-general/2008-November/005505.html).</sup>
